value.name: In aftermath of Andrew Brown's killing, echoes of North Carolina's awful history of scapegoating Black people
value.description: We do not know all the details of how Brown responded when officers confronted him outside his home, write Rev. William Barber and Jonathan Wilson-Hartgrove. But we do know that this law enforcement action and officials' unwillingness to -- publicly and with dispatch -- show what happened fits within a long history of White authorities in Eastern North Carolina treating Black people and the Black community as a threat.

value.name: George Floyd Died a Year Ago. The Third Reconstruction Is Underway
value.description: In Elizabeth City, N.C., the morning after a jury in Minneapolis found the former police officer Derek Chauvin guilty of the murder of George Floyd, a unit from the county’s Sheriff’s Department dressed in tactical gear arrived at the home of Andrew Brown Jr.

value.name: A Post-George Floyd 'Racial Reckoning' Missed Other Inequalities
value.description: Mr. Smith is an Opinion staff editor. in a note from deputy Opinion editor Patrick Healy in our Opinion Today newsletter. On a humid, windless night several years ago, I was driving my parents ...

value.name: Police Killed George Floyd. An MMA Fighter Punched Back.
value.description: Donald Williams II called 9-1-1 on Derek Chauvin and testified against the cop in court—but first he found courage in the violent cages of a combat sport. That history helps him grapple with the ...
